feat.name: Executioner Weapon Training
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Vigilante Dedication|APG}, member of the Gray Gardeners
entries: Your Gray Gardener training has made you deeply skilled with the weapons that execute with a swift chop to the neck. You become trained with the following weapons: battle axe, falchion, greataxe, and scimitar.
Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency with a given weapon or weapons, you also gain that proficiency for these weapons.

feat.name: Harsh Judgment
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Vigilante Dedication|APG}, member of the Gray Gardeners
entries: Choose one creature you can see, and loudly declare the creature's life forfeit by your judgment. That creature becomes your condemned foe until they are defeated, you use Harsh Judgment on a different creature, or the encounter ends. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to {@skill Perception} checks to {@action Seek} your condemned foe and on {@skill Intimidation} checks to {@action Demoralize} them. You have a –1 circumstance penalty to {@skill Perception} checks to {@action Seek} creatures other than your condemned foe and on {@skill Intimidation} checks to {@action Demoralize} anyone other than your condemned foe.
You typically can use Harsh Judgment only during an encounter, and if you try to use it to declare someone's life forfeit during exploration or downtime, you are likely to start an encounter.

feat.name: Voice of Authority
feat.prerequisites: expert in {@skill Intimidation}, {@feat Vigilante Dedication|APG}, member of the Gray Gardeners
entries: You easily command the attention of others, and when the time comes to turn threats into action, your authoritative voice causes foes to falter.

Your voice be heard easily by any creatures within 300 feet if you wish, regardless of the level of ambient noise, although your voice can't penetrate silence or similar effect. If you roll {@skill Intimidation} for initiative, on the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are {@condition flat-footed} to you.

feat.name: Discerning Gaze
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Vigilante Dedication|APG}, member of the Gray Gardeners
entries: You have a sense for when people are lying. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus on your secret {@skill Perception} checks to {@action Sense Motive}.

If you use {@action Sense Motive} on a creature you have currently condemned with Harsh Judgment, your GM rolls the {@skill Perception} check twice and takes the higher result (this is a {@trait fortune} effect).

feat.name: Frightful Condemnation
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Harsh Judgment|NGD}, {@feat Vigilante Dedication|APG}, member of the Gray Gardeners
feat.trigger: You hit your condemned foe with a melee {@action Strike} in the same turn during which you condemned it with Harsh Judgment.
feat.requirements: You have condemned a foe to death with {@feat Harsh Judgment|NGD}.
entries: Your willingness to follow through on your pitiless judgment is frightful to the person you have condemned, and they begin to dread what you will do to them next.
Your condemned foe is {@condition frightened||frightened 1}, or {@condition frightened||frightened 2} if the triggering {@action Strike} was a critical hit.

feat.name: Accurate Swing
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Harsh Judgment|NGD}, {@feat Vigilante Dedication|APG}, member of the Gray Gardeners
entries: You strike cleanly with wide, sweeping attacks to inflict maximum damage, taking advantage of your judged foe's fear to land a felling blow. If you {@action Strike} a creature you condemned with Harsh Judgment that has the {@condition frightened} condition with a sweep melee weapon or a sweep unarmed attack, you gain a circumstance bonus to the {@action Strike}'s damage equal to the number of weapon damage dice your weapon deals.

feat.name: Gardener's Resolve
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Vigilante Dedication|APG}, member of the Gray Gardeners
feat.trigger: You roll a failure (but not a critical failure) on a Will save against a {@trait fear} effect.
entries: The Gray Gardeners are known for having nerves of steel and an unbreakable resolve. When you would be overwhelmed by terror, you can draw upon this resolve to keep your composure and remain undaunted. You take mental damage equal to twice your level, and the saving throw is a success.

feat.name: Reminder of the Greater Fear
feat.trigger: Another creature within 30 feet of you that can see you would gain the {@condition frightened} condition.
entries: You give a target a stern glower to remind them that it is you, and no one else, they should truly fear. Reduce the value of the {@condition frightened} condition the creature would take by 1.

feat.name: Strident Command
feat.prerequisites: master in {@skill Intimidation}, {@feat Vigilante Dedication|APG}, {@feat Voice of Authority|NGD}, member of the Gray Gardeners
entries: The common folk heed your demands, and though your true foes rarely bend to your commands, when they do the hesitation can cost them the battle. You can cast {@spell command} once every 10 minutes as a 1st-level occult innate spell.

If you're in your vigilante identity, you can command the target only to approach you, drop {@condition prone}, or stand in place. If you're in your social identity, you can command the target only to run away or release what the target is holding.

feat.name: Execution
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Harsh Judgment|NGD}, {@feat Vigilante Dedication|APG}, member of the Gray Gardeners
feat.requirements: You have condemned a foe with {@feat Harsh Judgment|NGD}.
entries: You swing wide, attempting to behead your condemned foe. Make a melee {@action Strike} against your condemned foe. If you hit, your condemned foe takes {@dice 8d6} extra precision damage with a basic Fortitude save against your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher. If the condemned foe is reduced to 0 Hit Points by the execution and requires a head to live, they die. For creatures with multiple heads, this usually kills the creature only if you sever its last head. The creature then becomes temporarily immune to your Execution for 1 day.

feat.name: Terrifying Countenance
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Vigilante Dedication|APG}, member of the Gray Gardeners
entries: You can erect a magical cowl that terrorizes your enemies. Once per day, you can cast {@spell mask of terror} as an innate occult spell, targeting yourself. If you critically hit a creature that's temporarily immune to the spell, the creature's temporary immunity ends.
